alexandreyc commented on pull request #4549: ARROW-4973: [Go] implement ArraySliceEqual
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4549#discussion_r293539471
 
 

 ##########
 File path: go/arrow/array/compare.go
 ##########
 @@ -114,6 +114,16 @@ func ArrayEqual(left, right Interface) bool {
 	}
 }
 
+// ArraySliceEqual reports whether slices left[lbeg:lend] and right[rbeg:rend] are equal.
+func ArraySliceEqual(left Interface, lbeg, lend int64, right Interface, rbeg, rend int64) bool {
 
 Review comment:
   Why do we use `int64` for slice bounds while we use `int` for array length? Should we use `int` for everything?
   
   Otherwise LGTM.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

sbinet commented on pull request #4549: ARROW-4973: [Go] implement ArraySliceEqual
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4549#discussion_r293549869
 
 

 ##########
 File path: go/arrow/array/compare.go
 ##########
 @@ -114,6 +114,16 @@ func ArrayEqual(left, right Interface) bool {
 	}
 }
 
+// ArraySliceEqual reports whether slices left[lbeg:lend] and right[rbeg:rend] are equal.
+func ArraySliceEqual(left Interface, lbeg, lend int64, right Interface, rbeg, rend int64) bool {
 
 Review comment:
   yeah, I think @nickpoorman made that comment at some point.
   we probably need to homogenize a bit this corner of the code.
   
   I initially thought `int` would always suffice for arrays as I thought they would always be backed by some kind of `[]T`.
   but then I came across `array.Chunked` which may consist of multiple `[]T` presented as a logical `[]T`. (same for `Records`)
   
   so... we'd probably need to mass rename `s/int/int64/`.
   
   would you mind opening a jira ticket about this?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nickpoorman commented on pull request #4549: ARROW-4973: [Go] implement ArraySliceEqual
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4549#discussion_r293580879
 
 

 ##########
 File path: go/arrow/array/compare.go
 ##########
 @@ -114,6 +114,16 @@ func ArrayEqual(left, right Interface) bool {
 	}
 }
 
+// ArraySliceEqual reports whether slices left[lbeg:lend] and right[rbeg:rend] are equal.
+func ArraySliceEqual(left Interface, lbeg, lend int64, right Interface, rbeg, rend int64) bool {
 
 Review comment:
   Unless we create some sort of "chunks" concept for storing things like arrays of columns, I've been taking the approach that row length int64 and column length is int.

comments.body: Can you elaborate what you are asking for here?
Comparing two contiguous sub-array (slices). Not sure if it's really useful though...
